        public static java.util.Date convertWindowsTimeToDate(double comTime)
        converts a windows time to a Java Date Object
        Parameters:
        comTime - time in windows format
        Returns:
        Date object representing the windows time as specified in comTime

      • convertWindowsTimeToMilliseconds

        public static long convertWindowsTimeToMilliseconds(double comTime)
        Convert a COM time from functions Date(), Time(), Now() to a Java time (milliseconds). Visual Basic time values are based to 30.12.1899, Java time values are based to 1.1.1970 (= 0 milliseconds). The difference is added to the Visual Basic value to get the corresponding Java value. The Visual Basic double value reads: <day count delta since 30.12.1899>. <1 day percentage fraction >, e.g. "38100.6453" means: 38100 days since 30.12.1899 plus (24 hours * 0.6453). Example usage: Date javaDate = new Date(toMilliseconds (vbDate));.
        Parameters:
        comTime - COM time.
        Returns:
        Java time.

      • convertDateToWindowsTime

        public static double convertDateToWindowsTime(java.util.Date javaDate)
        converts a java date to a windows time object (is this timezone safe?)
        Parameters:
        javaDate - the java date to be converted to windows time
        Returns:
        the double representing the date in a form windows understands

        Returns:
